t: Psalm 107
Thanksgiving for God’s Deliverance
Give*pn thanks to the Lord,*s for he is good; his*ln faithful love endures forever.
Let*ln the redeemed of the Lord*s proclaim that*ln he has redeemed them from the power of the foe
and*ln has gathered them from the lands — from*ln the east and the west, from*ln the north and the south.
Some*pn wandered in the desolate wilderness, finding*ln no way to a city where they could live.
They*ln were hungry and thirsty; their*ln spirits failed within them.
Then*ln they cried out to the Lord*s in their trouble; he*ln rescued them from their distress.
He*ln led them by the right path to*ln go to a city where they could live.
Let*ln them give thanks to the Lord*s for*ln his faithful love and*ln his wondrous works for all humanity.
For*ln he has satisfied the thirsty and*ln filled the hungry with good things.
Others*pn sat in darkness and gloom— prisoners*ln in cruel chains—
because*ln they rebelled against God’s commands and*ln despised the counsel of the Most High.
He*ln broke their spirits with hard labor; they*ln stumbled, and there was no one to help.
Then*ln they cried out to the Lord*s in their trouble; he*ln saved them from their distress.
He*ln brought them out of darkness and gloom and*ln broke their chains apart.
Let*ln them give thanks to the Lord*s for*ln his faithful love and*ln his wondrous works for all humanity.
For*ln he has broken down the bronze gates and*ln cut through the iron bars.
Fools*pn suffered affliction because*ln of their rebellious ways and their iniquities.
They*ln loathed all food and*ln came near the gates of death.
Then*ln they cried out to the Lord*s in their trouble; he*ln saved them from their distress.
He*ln sent his word and healed them; he*ln rescued them from their traps.
Let*ln them give thanks to the Lord*s for*ln his faithful love and*ln his wondrous works for all humanity.
Let*ln them offer thanksgiving sacrifices and*ln announce his works with shouts of joy.
Others*pn went to sea in ships, conducting*ln trade on the vast water.
They*ln saw the Lord’s*s works, his*ln wondrous works in the deep.
He*ln spoke and raised a stormy wind that*ln stirred up the waves of the sea.
Rising*ln up to the sky, sinking down to the depths, their*ln courage melting away in anguish,
they*ln reeled and staggered like a drunkard, and*ln all their skill was useless.
Then*ln they cried out to the Lord*s in their trouble, and*ln he brought them out of their distress.
He*ln stilled the storm to a whisper, and*ln the waves of the sea were hushed.
They*ln rejoiced when the waves grew quiet. Then*ln he guided them to the harbor they longed for.
Let*ln them give thanks to the Lord*s for*ln his faithful love and*ln his wondrous works for all humanity.
Let*ln them exalt him in the assembly of the people and*ln praise him in the council of the elders.
He*pn turns rivers into desert, springs*ln into thirsty ground,
and*ln fruitful land into salty wasteland, because*ln of the wickedness of its inhabitants.
He*ln turns a desert into a pool, dry*ln land into springs.
He*ln causes the hungry to settle there, and*ln they establish a city where they can live.
They*ln sow fields and plant vineyards that*ln yield a fruitful harvest.
He*ln blesses them, and they multiply greatly; he*ln does not let their livestock decrease.
When*pn they are diminished and are humbled by*ln cruel oppression and sorrow,
he*ln pours contempt on nobles and*ln makes them wander in a trackless wasteland.
But*ln he lifts the needy out of their suffering and*ln makes their families multiply like flocks.
The*ln upright see it and rejoice, and*ln all injustice shuts its mouth.
Let*pn whoever is wise pay attention to these things and*ln consider the Lord’s*s acts of faithful love.
